intro: Spinifex paradoxus, commonly known as the coastal spinifex, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Spinifex paradoxus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
